Robert Cummings. His greatest success was on TV in the later half of the 1950's. But he was a popular light leading man in movies for 20 years before that, with "The Devil and Miss Jones" (1941), "Kings Row" (1942) and "Dial M For Murder" (1954) as my favorites. https://t.co/vomV3tpx3B

@davidraider88 The run from 51’-60’ is insane; Strangers on a Train, Dial M for Murder, Rear Window, To Catch a Thief, Vertigo, North By Northwest and Psycho. Not the only movies he made in the span, but damn near all of those are all timers.
@ericbaber87 Hitchcock releasing Rear Window and Dial M For Murder in the same year is hilarious. Every other director should’ve quit after that.
